unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Excitement!**
normalised: **energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies spark excitement!**

unnormalised: Hey folks, thinking of going solar? Good news! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is still dishing out some sweet subsidies for rooftop solar installations, and it's got everyone from Kanpur to Kanyakumari buzzing!
normalised: hey folks, thinking of going solar? good news! the ministry of new and renewable energy (M N R E) is still dishing out some sweet subsidies for rooftop solar installations, and it's got everyone from kanpur to kanyakumari buzzing!

unnormalised: Remember that neighbour, Sharmaji? He finally installed his system and is already bragging about his reduced electricity bills. Turns out, the subsidy knocked a good chunk off the initial cost. We're talking potential savings of up to 40% depending on the size of your setup, folks! That's like having a free Diwali bonus every year!
normalised: remember that neighbor, sharmaji? he finally installed his system and is already bragging about his reduced electricity bills. turns out, the subsidy knocked a good chunk off the initial cost. we're talking potential savings of up to forty percent depending on the size of your setup, folks! that's like having a free diwali bonus every year!

unnormalised: MNRE officials confirmed they're pushing for faster approvals, but paperwork can still be a bit of a "3 Idiots" kinda hurdle. But seriously, it's worth it.
normalised: M N R E officials confirmed they're pushing for faster approvals, but paperwork can still be a bit of a "three idiots" kinda hurdle. but seriously, it's worth it.

unnormalised: Think of it this way: invest now, save later, and bask in the sunshine knowing you're helping Mother Earth, and your wallet! Check your state discom website for specific schemes and eligibility. Rs. 50,000 to Rs. 2 lakh subsidy potential, who wouldn't want that? Get going! Don't be the last one on the block to get solar!
normalised: think of it this way: invest now, save later, and bask in the sunshine knowing you're helping mother earth, and your wallet! check your state discom website for specific schemes and eligibility. rupee fifty thousand to rupee two lakh subsidy potential, who wouldn't want that? get going! don't be the last one on the block to get solar!
